From the Thai military camp on a ridge at the edge of the border, you can look out over no mans land and the sweeping expanse of Myanmar and its remote Shan states. With b binoculars you can even see the waving Myanmar flag marking the Myanmar military base on the other side.

There are also greenhouses where there is serious cultivation of crops normally found in colder climes: strawberries, rhubarb, and persimmons. More than just a beautiful site, this place bears particular significance as this is a showcase for the success of the king's initiative which started 30 years ago to wean the hill tribes off growing opium to more productive crops.
